clues.clue: Head north from Brighton city center along the A23 London Road for approximately 2.1 kilometers. Turn right (east) onto Preston Road, then after 150 meters turn left (north) onto Ditchling Road. Continue northeast for 400 meters until you reach the distinctive Victorian red brick terraced houses with ornate white window frames and bay windows. Located precisely 343.75 kilometers from the Church of the Good Shepherd to your southwest and 343.76 kilometers from THERAPEUTIC PILATES to your southeast, you'll find a three-story Victorian terrace building constructed circa 1880s featuring characteristic yellow London stock brick facade with decorative white stucco window surrounds and black painted iron railings. On this building's street-facing wall, the "Wade Smith" painted artwork spans approximately 4 meters wide by 3 meters tall, executed in vibrant acrylic paints with commercial typography styling merged with contemporary street art techniques, incorporating symbolic elements rendered in bold blues, reds, and yellows, created in 2019 and tagged as Commercial, Street Art, and Symbolic.

clues.clue: From St Mary's Roman Catholic Church, head 509 meters northeast along the main thoroughfare, then turn right (east) at the second intersection and continue 200 meters. The artwork "Reverie" is located on the eastern facade of a three-storey Victorian terraced residential building with red brick construction, white-painted window frames, and a traditional slate roof. This 2024 painted mural spans approximately 15 feet in height across the building's side wall, featuring vibrant depictions of urban wildlife including foxes and birds integrated with flowing organic environmental motifs of intertwining vines and leaves, executed in a contemporary street art style with bold color blocking and symbolic elements including geometric patterns representing the cycle of nature. The building sits 509 meters northeast of St Mary's Roman Catholic Church and 80 meters northwest of Preston Park Brighton & Hove, positioned on the north-facing side of the street in the residential quarter of north Brighton, with the artwork clearly visible when approaching from the western compass direction along the tree-lined residential road.

clues.clue: Starting from Brighton Railway Station, head north-northeast for approximately 1.2 miles along Queen's Road, then turn right (east) onto Dyke Road for 0.3 miles. Turn left (north) onto Stanford Road and continue for 0.4 miles until you reach the landmark Stanford And Cleveland Community Garden on your right side. From this community garden landmark, continue north for exactly 152 meters, then turn right (east) onto Surrenden Road. Walk east for 89 meters until you spot St Matthias Church with its distinctive Victorian Gothic spire on your left (north) side - this serves as your second landmark. The "Punch Bowl Murals" painted artwork is located directly across from St Matthias Church on a converted two-story Victorian terraced house with bay windows on the south side of Surrenden Road. The building features a dark brick facade with white window frames. The complete mural covers the entire front wall and depicts vibrant animals including foxes and birds integrated with human figures and natural elements like trees and flowers, executed in bold street art style with spray paint and acrylic mediums.
